intro.title: Welcome
intro.content: Find out which Building Code applies to you

content.value: Are you a head contractor or a subcontractor?
Did you tender for the project before 2 December 2016?

options.label: No, I tendered on or after 2 December 2016

content.value: You are required to comply with the Building Code 2013 if it is a Commonwealth funded project.*
content.infoText:
When engaging subcontractors on this Commonwealth funded project you should use the ABCC information statement and advertisement clause when calling for or receiving EOIs or tenders from 2 December 2016.

You are not a 2016 Code covered entity on this project. 

You should not require a letter of compliance from subcontractors with either the Building Code 2013 or Building Code 2016. 

The ABCC will monitor compliance on the project. This includes the subcontractors' compliance with section 11 of the 2016 Code's content requirements for enterprise agreements made on or after 2 December 2016.

* To be subject to the Code, indirectly funded projects must have Commonwealth funding of at least $10 million, or more than $5 million where this represents at least half of the total construction project value.

You are also required to comply with the 2013 Code if it is a privately funded project for which you tendered after you submitted a tender for Commonwealth funded building work (where this Commonwealth tender was before 2 December 2016). If you tender for Commonwealth funded work on or after 2 December 2016 you will be required to comply with the 2016 Code on any privately funded projects you bid for after that tender. On a privately funded project, you should not use the ABCC Information Statement, the Model Clauses or require a letter of compliance with the 2013 Code or 2016 Code from subcontractors who tender for the project.

content.value: You are required to comply with the Building Code 2016 if it is a Commonwealth funded project.*
content.infoText:
You should use Model Clause Type B  when engaging subcontractors.

You should require a letter of compliance with the 2016 Code from subcontractors who tender for the project.

* To be subject to the Code, indirectly funded projects must have Commonwealth funding of at least $10 million, or more than $5 million where this represents at least half of the total construction project value.

You are also required to comply with the 2016 Code if it is a privately funded project for which you tendered after you submitted a tender for Commonwealth funded building work (where this Commonwealth tender was on or after 2 December 2016). On a privately funded project, you should not use Model Clauses or require a letter of compliance with the 2016 Code from subcontractors who tender for the project.
